The Third Foundation: The knowledge that He, exalted is He, while being eternal (Azali) everlasting (Abadi), has no end to His existence, so He is the First (Al-Awwal) and the Last (Al-Akhir) and the Manifest (Al-Zahir) and the Hidden (Al-Batin) because what has been established as eternal (Qidm) is impossible to be non-existent. Its proof is that if He were to become non-existent, it would not be free from either becoming non-existent by Himself or by a nullifier that opposes Him. And if it were permissible for something whose continuity is conceivable to become non-existent, then it would be permissible for something whose non-existence is conceivable to exist by itself. Just as the coming into being (Turyan) of existence needs a cause, similarly the coming into being of non-existence needs a cause. And it is false that He becomes non-existent by a nullifier that opposes Him because that nullifier, if it were eternal (Qadim), existence with it would not be conceivable. And it has become clear through the two previous foundations His existence and His eternity (Qidm), so how could His existence be in eternity (Qidm) while with Him is His opposite? If the opposing nullifier is originated (Hadith), it is impossible, for the originated (Hadith) is not in opposing the eternal (Qadim) so as to cut off His existence more deserving than the eternal (Qadim) in opposing the originated (Hadith) so as to repel its existence. Rather, repelling is easier than cutting off, and the eternal (Qadim) is stronger and more deserving than the originated (Hadith).

And that is only by way of overpowering [qahr] and mastery [istila'], as the poet said: Bishr has established himself over Iraq Without a sword and without bloodshed. And the people of truth [ahl al-haqq] were compelled to this interpretation [ta'wil], just as the people of inward meaning [ahl al-batin] were compelled to interpret His saying, the Exalted: "And He is with you wherever you are"â€”since it was agreed to understand that as encompassing [ihata] and knowledge [ilm]. And to interpret His saying, "The heart [qalb] of the believer is between two fingers of the fingers of the Most Merciful" as power [qudra] and strength [quwwa]. And to interpret His saying, "The Black Stone is the right hand of God on His earth" as honor [tashrif] and veneration [ikram]. For if it were left according to its outward [zahir] meaning, impossibility [muhal] would necessarily follow from it. And Abu Bakr al-Warraq said: 'Truthfulness (Sidq) is three: truthfulness in Oneness (Tawhid), truthfulness in obedience (Taa'ah), and truthfulness in knowledge (Ma'rifah). Indeed, if you seek the highest degrees [darajat], then strive that none precede you in obedience to Allah, the Exalted, for Allah has commanded you to race and compete in it. He, the Exalted, said: "Race towards forgiveness from your Lord." And He, the Exalted, said: "And for that let the competitors compete." And it is astonishing that if your peers or neighbors precede you by an extra dirham or by a taller building, that weighs heavily upon you and your chest tightens because of it, and your life becomes bitter due to envy. Yet, the best of your states is that you reside in Paradise [al-jannah] while you are not safe therein from people who precede you with subtleties [lata'if] that the entire world [al-dunya] cannot equal. Indeed, Abu Sa'id al-Khudri said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, the people of Paradise [ahl al-jannah] see the people of the elevated chambers above them as you see the setting star on the horizon from east to west, due to the superiority between them." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, those are the dwellings of the prophets, none but them attain them." He said: "Yes, by the One in Whose Hand is my soul, men who believed in Allah and believed the messengers." And he also said: "Indeed, the people of the highest degrees [darajat] are seen by those beneath them as you see the rising star on a horizon of the horizons of the sky. And Abu Bakr and 'Umar are among them, and how excellent they are." And Jabir said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to us: "Shall I not inform you of the chambers of Paradise [ghuraf al-jannah]?" I said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah, may my father and mother be sacrificed for you." He said: "Indeed, in Paradise are chambers of every kind of jewel, their exterior is seen from their interior and their interior from their exterior. And in them is bliss [na'im] and pleasures and joy that no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart [qalb] of any human." He said: "O Messenger of Allah, and for whom are these chambers?" He said: "For the one who spreads peace [afsha al-salam], feeds food [at'ama al-ta'am], persists in fasting [adama al-siyam], and prays at night while people are asleep." We said: "O Messenger of Allah, and who can bear that?" He said: "My nation can bear that, and I will inform you of it: Whoever meets his brother and greets him with peace or returns the greeting to him has spread peace. And whoever feeds his family and dependents from food until he satisfies them has fed food. And whoever fasts the month of Ramadan and three days from every month has persisted in fasting. And whoever prays the last 'Isha' prayer and prays the morning prayer in congregation has prayed at night while people are asleep." Meaning the Jews, the Christians, and the Magians.
